page.title: 20Social concerns
page.content: There is great concern in Linslade that the nearest major hospital facilities are 12 miles away, and communications with them are not good. There is high local support for the proposal to provide a Community Hospital in the town to complement the more intensive high technology treatment centres at Luton and Aylesbury and provide more accessible support for the elderly. Because of the continuing teachers' unrest, children are being released from school at 2.00pm. This is a cause for concern amongst many parents who work until late afternoon and are worried about their children getting into trouble after school. Straw burning continues to be an activity which causes much anger locally. Farmers are being restricted as to when and how they burn off.
